account.descriptionLink:
USDT is the leading stablecoin that provides stability and liquidity across most ecosystems including Solana. USDT is fully backed by reserves such as traditional currency and cash equivalents and may include other assets and receivables from loans made by Tether to third parties. USDT also undergoes continuous audits.

Potentil Risks:
Mainly depeg risk. Since 2019 it has become public knowledge that USDT is not backed by solely fiat currency. There is a variety of loans, precious metals, and digital tokens backing Tether.

Voting End Date: 12 July 2022
account.name: Jet Protocol --- $USDT Collateral Onboarding Vote

account.descriptionLink:
The following proposal will determine if $SOBTC, which is already a listed asset, should be kept on a go forward basis.

Sollet Wrapped Bitcoin is an SPL token minted when a bitcoin is bridged from the native Bitcoin network to the Solana Ecosystem. It is the most liquid form of bitcoin on the Solana network.

Potential Risks:
Sollet Wrapped Bitcoin does not have the same amount of liquidity as the native Bitcoin network. There is also risk introduced anytime an asset is bridged from their native blockchain to Solana.

Voting End Date:
28 June 2022

Voting Address:
J6zWfYSNBay71s8eNL2TNcDf2XrFTVJmDSBp4WKexjc5
account.name: Jet Protocol -- $SOBTC Collateral Onboarding Vote

account.descriptionLink:
Mango devs want to replace the current BNB/USDC spot market ($28.48k TVL, $651.20 24hr Volume) with a newer, more liquid market ($310.12k TVL, $215.49k 24hr Volume).

Deeper liquidity, higher transaction volume. 

Current:
https://projectserum.vybenetwork.com/#/markets/3zzTxtDCt9PimwzGrgWJEbxZfSLetDMkdYegPanGNpMf

Proposed:
https://projectserum.vybenetwork.com/#/markets/4UPUurKveNEJgBqJzqHPyi8DhedvpYsMXi7d43CjAg2f
account.name: Mango DAO --- Swap BNB Serum Market

account.descriptionLink: Fund a new company led by Mango Max with $600,000 and up to 20,000 SOL (performance based) for one year to employ engineers to contribute to Solana core so that Mango runs with highest reliability and lowest latency. DAO to receive a grant from Solana Foundation of 200,000 SOL per year.
account.name: Mango DAO --- Mangolana

account.descriptionLink:
Market Making Partnership with Lifinity (2M MNDE Grant)

Pros: Deeper liquidity & lower fees / slippage on mSOL trades. Lifinity provides the initial $1M in liquidity. Lifinity will lock the 2M MNDE + rewards from liquidity mining for at least 1 yr and participate in governance - reduced selling pressure

Cons: Lifinity will likely control a decent chunk of liquidity mining rewards via gauge voting. Additional smart contract risk 

Details: https://forum.marinade.finance/t/mdao-proposal-market-making-partnership-with-lifinity-modified/245
account.name: Marinade --- Market Making Partnership with Lifinity

account.descriptionLink:
mSOL is the liquid staking derivative token received when staking SOL with Marinade Finance. mSOL acts as a “receipt” for your staked SOL, allowing you to withdraw your initial SOL deposit and the accumulated rewards at any time.

mSOL is widely integrated in Solana DeFi and can be used as a value-accruing equivalent of SOL, making it fundamentally more efficient than holding SOL.

Pros: Over 60k wallets hold mSOL. $240M mkt cap asset with high liquidity.

Cons: Total supply fluctuates based on staking activity. Limited CEX support. mSOL tracks the price of SOL and has not experienced an unexpected price deviation to date, but you never know what can happen in DeFi.
account.name: Jet Protocol --- $mSOL Collateral Onboarding Vote

account.descriptionLink:
Withdraw 100 mSOL to DAO treasury for future costs of running DAO e.g proposal creation.

To be withdrawn from Mango account owned by DAO to treasury account. Small amount, but any transaction from an account that is owned by Mango DAO needs to be approved through governance, even if it's just $1.
account.name: Mango DAO --- Withdraw 100 mSOL to DAO Treasury

account.descriptionLink:
Grant of 25,000 $USDC for work on a governance rewards plugin: https://github.com/wizzeh/governance-rewards 

Plugin will enable various use cases from distributing protocol revenue, airdrops to active governance participants or to distribute the whole treasury to token holders in case a token is trading below NAV and DAO wants to disband. 

Project is mostly finished at this point. Ellie worked with Sebastian (Solana Labs) and Max (Mango Markets) on this plugin.
account.name: Mango DAO --- Grant for Ellie (25k USDC)

account.descriptionLink:
Castle sources yield from lending projects on Solana  (Solend, Port, and Jet). It prioritizes minimizing risk over maximizing returns. Funds are only sent to open-source, audited protocols. Proposed allocation represents < 1% of Mango DAO Treasury assets. 

Pros:
Strong team. Already integrated with Realms & fully audited by Bramah Systems. Castle's plan to integrate Mango into yield strategy would reinforce Mango's own lending liquidity. No lockup period. 

Cons / Potential Risks:
Introduces additional smart contract risk for < 10% yield. Code has not been audited by Mango core team. Proposed allocation represents 50% of current Castle TVL.
account.name: Mango DAO --- Allocate 500,000 USDC from Treasury to the Castle Vault

account.descriptionLink:
Collect a greater share of fees generated from Unstake liquidity pool (currently 25% treasury, 75% LPs - new split is 50/50).

Raise mgmt fees to 6% (prev 2%, currently 0% under Prop #2).

Shift more delegated SOL balance to validators with lower fees (ie 6% vs 10% commission) to offset increase in mgmt fees and prevent them from being passed on to end users.


Pros: need $ to pay bills, largest liquid stake pool on Solana survives and retains talent, more validators may be inclined to lock MNDE to participate in gov to ensure their stake is sticky 


Cons: overrides previous agreement with community (Prop #2), validators btw 8-10% likely to see stake reduced
account.name: Marinade --- Delegation strategy and fee structure changes

account.descriptionLink:
DAO needs to pay for two invoices from Triton for RPC services.

Invoice 1: 14,400.00 USD 
Invoice date: 1 Jun 2022

Invoice 2: 16,200.00 USD 
Invoice date: 1 Jul 2022

Total: 30,600.00 USD
account.name: Mango DAO --- Payment to Triton for RPC Services

account.descriptionLink:
- Collect a greater share of fees generated from Unstake liquidity pool (currently 25% treasury, 75% LPs - new split is 50/50)
- Raise mgmt fees to 6% (prev 2%, currently 0% under Prop #2)
- Shift more delegated SOL balance to validators with lower fees (ie 6% vs 10% commission) to offset increase in mgmt fees and prevent them from being passed on to end users

Pros: need $ to pay bills, largest liquid stake pool on Solana survives and retains talent, more validators may be inclined to lock MNDE to participate in gov to ensure their stake is sticky
Cons: overrides previous agreement with community (Prop #2), validators btw 8-10% likely to see stake reduced
account.name: Marinade --- Delegation strategy and fee structure changes

account.descriptionLink: Formally move Luna spot and perp to CloseOnly so it no longer needs to be hardcoded in the program
account.name: Mango DAO --- LUNA spot/perp to CloseOnly
